back_cards.definition_en: A large animal used for riding or work.
back_cards.example_en: She rode a horse along the trail.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of strength or speed.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s engine has the power of 300 horses.

back_cards.definition_en: An animal in sports or racing.
back_cards.example_en: He bet on a horse at the racetrack.

back_cards.definition_en: A farm animal for agricultural tasks.
back_cards.example_en: The farmer used a horse to plow the field.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece in the game of chess.
back_cards.example_en: She moved the horse to capture the pawn.

back_cards.definition_en: A condition giving a benefit or edge.
back_cards.example_en: Her experience gave her an advantage in the job interview.

back_cards.definition_en: A favorable opportunity in competition.
back_cards.example_en: The team took advantage of their opponent’s mistake.

back_cards.definition_en: A benefit that improves a situation.
back_cards.example_en: Living near the station is a big advantage.

back_cards.definition_en: A gain in business or strategy.
back_cards.example_en: The new software gave the company a market advantage.

back_cards.definition_en: A positive feature of a product.
back_cards.example_en: The phone’s battery life is its main advantage.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to business or trade.
back_cards.example_en: The commercial district is full of shops.

back_cards.definition_en: Intended for profit or advertising.
back_cards.example_en: The TV showed a commercial for a new car.

back_cards.definition_en: Designed for widespread use.
back_cards.example_en: This is a commercial version of the software.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to commerce or sales.
back_cards.example_en: The commercial success of the product was unexpected.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving large-scale production.
back_cards.example_en: The farm switched to commercial farming methods.

back_cards.definition_en: To take something without permission.
back_cards.example_en: Someone tried to steal her purse in the market.

back_cards.definition_en: To take an opportunity or advantage.
back_cards.example_en: He stole a glance at the test answers.

back_cards.definition_en: To move quietly or secretly.
back_cards.example_en: She stole into the room without being noticed.

back_cards.definition_en: To gain something at a low cost.
back_cards.example_en: I stole this jacket for only ten dollars!

back_cards.definition_en: To win or take in sports or games.
back_cards.example_en: The player stole the ball and scored.

back_cards.definition_en: The foundation or reason for something.
back_cards.example_en: Trust is the basis of a good friendship.

back_cards.definition_en: A starting point for decisions.
back_cards.example_en: We chose the plan on the basis of cost.

back_cards.definition_en: A regular or consistent schedule.
back_cards.example_en: She works on a part-time basis now.

back_cards.definition_en: A principle or underlying concept.
back_cards.example_en: The theory has a scientific basis.

back_cards.definition_en: A system for organizing or measuring.
back_cards.example_en: Grades are calculated on a weekly basis.

back_cards.definition_en: The circumstances surrounding an event or situation.
back_cards.example_en: His joke made sense in the context of the story.

back_cards.definition_en: The background that clarifies meaning.
back_cards.example_en: You need context to understand this poem.

back_cards.definition_en: The setting or environment of a discussion.
back_cards.example_en: In the context of work, her idea was brilliant.

back_cards.definition_en: The framework for interpreting information.
back_cards.example_en: The article provides context for the new law.

back_cards.definition_en: The surrounding words in a sentence.
back_cards.example_en: The word’s meaning depends on its context.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great degree or extent.
back_cards.example_en: Her work is highly regarded by her peers.

back_cards.definition_en: In a very favorable or positive way.
back_cards.example_en: He speaks highly of his new teacher.

back_cards.definition_en: At a high level or intensity.
back_cards.example_en: The team is highly motivated to win.

back_cards.definition_en: In a sophisticated or advanced manner.
back_cards.example_en: The device is highly technical and complex.

back_cards.definition_en: With strong emphasis or praise.
back_cards.example_en: This restaurant comes highly recommended.

back_cards.definition_en: A Christian holiday celebrating Jesus’s birth.
back_cards.example_en: We decorate the tree for Christmas every year.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for family gatherings and gift-giving.
back_cards.example_en: They spent Christmas with their grandparents.

back_cards.definition_en: A festive season in December.
back_cards.example_en: The shops are busy during the Christmas season.

back_cards.definition_en: A cultural event with traditions like carols.
back_cards.example_en: The choir sang at the Christmas concert.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of celebration and goodwill.
back_cards.example_en: She wished everyone a merry Christmas.

back_cards.definition_en: Physical power or ability.
back_cards.example_en: His strength helped him lift the heavy box.

back_cards.definition_en: Mental or emotional resilience.
back_cards.example_en: She showed great strength during tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality that makes something effective.
back_cards.example_en: The strength of this glue is impressive.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong point or advantage.
back_cards.example_en: Her strength is her ability to stay calm.

back_cards.definition_en: The intensity or force of something.
back_cards.example_en: The storm’s strength caused widespread damage.

back_cards.definition_en: To change position or location.
back_cards.example_en: Please move your chair closer to the table.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate to a new place.
back_cards.example_en: They moved to a bigger house last month.

back_cards.definition_en: To take action or make progress.
back_cards.example_en: The team moved quickly to finish the project.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause an emotional response.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech moved the audience to tears.

back_cards.definition_en: To propose or suggest formally.
back_cards.example_en: He moved to adjourn the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: The first day of the workweek.
back_cards.example_en: I have a meeting every Monday morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A day associated with starting anew.
back_cards.example_en: She begins her diet every Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: A day for scheduling or planning.
back_cards.example_en: The class is held on Monday evenings.

back_cards.definition_en: A day in a sequence of events.
back_cards.example_en: The sale starts this Monday at the mall.

back_cards.definition_en: A day with cultural associations.
back_cards.example_en: Monday feels slow after the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To intend or have a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: I didn’t mean to upset you with my comment.

back_cards.definition_en: To signify or represent something.
back_cards.example_en: The red light means you must stop.

back_cards.definition_en: To have as a consequence.
back_cards.example_en: Missing the bus means I’ll be late.

back_cards.definition_en: To express or convey an idea.
back_cards.example_en: What do you mean by ‘freedom’ in this context?

back_cards.definition_en: To plan or intend to achieve.
back_cards.example_en: She means to finish her homework tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: Being by oneself without others.
back_cards.example_en: She prefers to study alone in her room.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling isolated or without help.
back_cards.example_en: He felt alone during his first day at school.

back_cards.definition_en: Unique or the only one.
back_cards.example_en: This shop is alone in selling rare books.

back_cards.definition_en: Without company or companionship.
back_cards.example_en: The old house stood alone on the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: Exclusively or solely.
back_cards.example_en: The decision was hers alone to make.

back_cards.definition_en: A sandy or pebbly shore by the sea.
back_cards.example_en: We spent the day relaxing on the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for recreation or vacation.
back_cards.example_en: The beach was crowded with tourists.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural coastal feature.
back_cards.example_en: The beach stretched for miles along the coast.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting for sports or activities.
back_cards.example_en: They played volleyball on the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: A location for social gatherings.
back_cards.example_en: The beach hosted a bonfire party at night.

back_cards.definition_en: A study or poll to gather opinions.
back_cards.example_en: The survey showed most people prefer coffee.

back_cards.definition_en: An examination of an area or land.
back_cards.example_en: The survey of the property took two days.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of data or feedback.
back_cards.example_en: The company sent out a customer survey.

back_cards.definition_en: A general overview or review.
back_cards.example_en: The book provides a survey of modern art.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal inspection or analysis.
back_cards.example_en: The survey revealed cracks in the bridge.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of composing text.
back_cards.example_en: Her writing improved after the workshop.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of written work.
back_cards.example_en: His writing was published in a magazine.

back_cards.definition_en: The skill or practice of creating text.
back_cards.example_en: Creative writing is her favorite subject.

back_cards.definition_en: Handwritten or typed content.
back_cards.example_en: The writing on the sign was hard to read.

back_cards.definition_en: A profession or activity of authorship.
back_cards.example_en: She earns a living through writing novels.

back_cards.definition_en: A person highly skilled in something.
back_cards.example_en: He is a master of chess strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: A title for someone in control or authority.
back_cards.example_en: The master of the house welcomed the guests.

back_cards.definition_en: A teacher or expert in a field.
back_cards.example_en: The master taught painting to beginners.

back_cards.definition_en: An original document or recording.
back_cards.example_en: The master copy of the film was preserved.

back_cards.definition_en: A degree or level of education.
back_cards.example_en: She earned a master’s degree in biology.

back_cards.definition_en: To shed tears due to emotion.
back_cards.example_en: She cried when she heard the sad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To shout or call out loudly.
back_cards.example_en: He cried for help during the emergency.

back_cards.definition_en: To express strong feelings vocally.
back_cards.example_en: The crowd cried in joy at the victory.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a loud sound, like an animal.
back_cards.example_en: The eagle cried as it soared above.

back_cards.definition_en: To demand or require attention.
back_cards.example_en: This issue cries for immediate action.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for measuring weight.
back_cards.example_en: She stepped on the scale to check her weight.

back_cards.definition_en: A range or extent of something.
back_cards.example_en: The scale of the project was massive.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of marks for measurement.
back_cards.example_en: The map has a scale of one inch to a mile.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of levels or grades.
back_cards.example_en: The job pays well on the salary scale.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin, flat piece, like on a fish.
back_cards.example_en: The fish’s scales sparkled in the sun.

back_cards.definition_en: A person living in a particular place.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a resident of the small coastal town.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a community or area.
back_cards.example_en: The residents met to discuss park improvements.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical trainee working in a hospital.
back_cards.example_en: The resident assisted in the surgery.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone with legal status in a place.
back_cards.example_en: He applied to become a permanent resident.

back_cards.definition_en: A long-term occupant of a building.
back_cards.example_en: The building’s residents share a gym.
